sections.name: Client Entity Documentation
content: Client entity definitions are contained within a Resource Pack.

To start, create a new folder and name it "entity" inside the root of the Resource Pack. In the entity folder create a JSON file and give it a name.The JSON file needs a format version and minecraft:client_entity information.

The minecraft:client_entity section contains the description for the entity. Under description there are a number of things that you can set about an entity. Generally, this file is defining what resources a mob requires and gives a friendly name to each, that the other definition files can use.
Example client entity definitions JSON for the pig
"format_version": "1.8.0",
"minecraft:client_entity": {
"description": {
"identifier": "minecraft:pig",
"min_engine_version": "1.8.0",
"materials": { "default": "pig" },
"textures": {
"default": "textures/entity/pig/pig",
"saddled": "textures/entity/pig/pig_saddle"
"geometry": {
"default": "geometry.pig.v1.8"
"animations": {
"setup": "animation.pig.setup",
"walk": "animation.quadruped.walk",
"look_at_target": "animation.common.look_at_target",
"baby_transform": "animation.pig.baby_transform"
"animation_controllers": [
{ "setup": "controller.animation.pig.setup" },
{ "move": "controller.animation.pig.move" },
{ "baby": "controller.animation.pig.baby" }
"render_controllers": [ "controller.render.pig" ],
"locators": {
"spawn_egg": {
"texture": "spawn_egg",
"texture_index": 2

sections.name: Spawn Egg
content: This sets the color or texture used for the entity Spawn Egg. There are 2 ways to do this. The first is to use the hex value for the base color and the overlay color.

sections.name: Hex Value
content: Example Spawn Egg using hex value
"spawn_egg": {
"base_color": "#53443E",
"overlay_color": "#2E6854"

sections.name: Texture
content: The other way is to specify a texture.

Example Spawn Egg specifying a texture. The texture is located in the "items_texture" JSON in the textures folder of the Resource Pack. When there are more than one texture associated with a texture name you can use an index to pick the one that you want. If no index is specified than it is assumed to be 0 and the first texture in the list is used.
Example Spawn Egg specifying a texture
"spawn_egg": {
"texture": "spawn_egg",
"texture_index": 2

sections.name: animation_controllers
content: Animation controllers decide which animations to play when. Each Controller contains a list of states that play one or more animations. Allows the player to assign names to reference the long names for animation controllers. Names are required and need to be unique from all other names in the animation controllers for that mob. Players can reference animation controllers from the vanilla Minecraft Resource Pack or create their own. Custom animation controllers should be in the animation_controllers folder at the root of the Resource Pack.

sections.name: animations
content: Allows the player to assign names to reference the long name for animations. These names are used by the animation controller JSON. Players can reference animations from the vanilla Minecraft Resource Pack or create their own. Custom animations should be in the animation folder at the root of the Resource Pack.

sections.name: enable_attachables
content: This determines if the entity can equip attachables when this is set to true. This allows the entity to render armor and weapons.
"enable_attachables": true

sections.name: held_item_ignores_lighting
content: This determines if the item held by an entity should render fully lit up (if true), or depending on surrounding lighting.
"held_item_ignores_lighting": true

sections.name: hide_armor
content: This determines if the armor attached to an entity should be hidden when set to true. This overrides the rendering settings specified by 'enable_attachables'
"hide_armor": true

sections.name: identifier
content: The identifier is used to register the entity with the server. In the Client Entity Definitions JSON the identifier sets the appearance of the entity(materials, textures, geometry, etc.) The matching identifier in the Entity Behavior JSON in the Behavior Pack is what gives the entity its behaviors.

sections.name: locators
content: Locator offsets are specified in model space. An example of a locator is the "lead" locator used to specify where the lead will attach to graphically.
"locators": {

sections.name: materials, textures, animations
content: Players can set the materials, texture and geometry used for the entity in this section. Players can set one or more materials, textures, and geometries that can be used by the mob. Players must set user defined names for them. These names are used in the Render Controllers JSON. Players can reference materials, textures, and geometry from the vanilla Minecraft Resource Pack or create their own.  Custom materials, textures, and geometry should be in the corresponding folder at the root of the Resource Pack.

sections.name: min_engine_version
content: When present, players can set the min version needed to allow the JSON to be parsed. The version in the definition is compared to the engine version for which the top resource pack was built.If a definition's min_engine_version is newer than that pack's engine version then the definition is not parsed.

Multiple definition files may use the same identifier, in which case only one of those definitions will be loaded. The definition with the same or closest and not greater min_engine_version, as compared to the top resource pack's engine version, will be parsed; all other definitions with the same identifier will not be parsed.

This can be useful for continuing to support an older version of an entity, when an older resource pack is used at the top of the resource pack stack, while also supporting a newer version of the entity in all other cases.

sections.name: particle
content: Allows the player to assign a key to reference the long name for particles. When these are present, the particle is created when the entity is spawned. Keys are required and need to be unique from all other keys in the animation controllers. Players can reference particles from the vanilla Minecraft Resource Pack or create their own. Custom particles should be in the particle folder at the root of the Resource Pack.

sections.name: render_controllers
content: Specifies the names of render controllers. This name needs to match the name of a corresponding JSON located in the Render Controllers folder. Players can reference Render Controllers from the vanilla Minecraft Resource Pack or create their own. Custom Render Controllers should be in the textures folder at the root of the Resource Pack.

sections.name: scripts
content: Scripts allow players to use Molang to compute calculations once and store that value. This value than can be used over and over again without the need to constantly recompute the calculations. Scripts currently support pre - animation and scale.More script types will be added later.
-Pre-animation scripts are evaluated immediately before animations are processed.
-Scale sets the scale of the mob's geometry.
Example pre-animation script for cod
"scripts": {
"pre_animation": [
"variable.ZRot = !query.is_in_water ? Math.cos((query.time_stamp + global.frame_alpha) * 14.32) * 90 : 0.0;",
"variable.AnimationAmountBlend = Math.lerp(variable.AnimationAmountPrev, variable.AnimationAmount, global.frame_alpha);"
Example scale script for the bat
"scripts": {

sections.name: Data-Driven Spawning
content: Data-Driven spawning allows you to adjust the spawn conditions of mobs, including new mobs added to the game to spawn naturally in biomes, add / remove a mob's spawn egg to the creative inventory and set the mob's spawn egg, and add / remove a to the / summon command

sections.name: Biome Tags
content: Each biome in the game has one or more tags. These are used to determine what biomes mobs spawn in. Here is the list of Biome tags that can be used:

sections.name: Conditions
content: Conditions contain different components that players can use to customize natural biome spawning.

rows.Name: minecraft:biome_filter
rows.Description: This component allows the players to specify which biomes the mob spawns in. Check below to see which Biome Tags exist, and what each biome is tagged as.

rows.Name: minecraft:brightness_filter
Description: This component allows players to set the light level range that causes the mob to spawn.

rows.Name: adjust_for_weather
rows.Description: This determines if weather can affect the light level conditions that cause the mob to spawn (e.g. Allowing hostile mobs to spawn during the day when it rains.)

rows.Name: max
rows.Description: This is the maximum light level value that allows the mob to spawn

rows.Name: min
rows.Description: This is the minimum light level value that allows the mob to spawn

rows.Name: minecraft:density_limit
Description: This component allows players to determine the density cap limits for the specified mob type.

rows.Name: surface
rows.Description: This is the maximum number of mobs of this type spawnable on the surface

rows.Name: underground
rows.Description: This is the maximum number of mobs of this type spawnable underground

rows.Name: minecraft:difficulty_filter
Description: This component allows players determine what mobs spawn when certain difficulty levels are set.

rows.Name: max
rows.Description: This is the maximum difficulty level that a mob spawns

rows.Name: min
rows.Description: This is the minimum difficulty level that a mob spawns

rows.Name: minecraft:herd
Description: This component allows players to determine the herd size of animals.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: This is an event that can be triggered from spawning

rows.Name: event_skip_count
rows.Description: This is the number of mobs spawned before the specified event is triggered

rows.Name: max_size
rows.Description: This is the maximum number of mobs that spawn in a herd

rows.Name: min_size
rows.Description: This is the minimum number of mobs that spawn in a herd

rows.Name: minecraft:spawns_on_surface
rows.Description: This component allows the mob to spawn on the ground. Adding the component causes it to be true, removing it causes the mob to stop spawning on the surface.

rows.Name: minecraft:spawns_underwater
rows.Description: This component allows the mob to spawn underwater. Adding the component causes it to be true, removing it causes the mob to stop spawning underwater.

rows.Name: minecraft:weight
Description: This component allows players to give a priority to how often that mob should spawn. Mobs with lower weight values have a higher chance to spawn than mobs with higher weight values.

rows.Name: default
rows.Description: This is the priority of the mob spawning

sections.name: Getting Started
content: New Spawn Rules are contained within a Behavior Pack. To begin, create a new folder named "spawn_rules" in the root of the Behavior Pack that you want to add the new biome spawn rules in. In the spawn_rules folder, create a JSON file and give it a name. The JSON file needs a format, description and conditions.Spawn rules contain description and conditionsAll Spawn Rules JSON need to have an ID (located under the description section). Similar to other identifiers, it follows the convention "namespace:name". The minecraft namespace is reserved for the vanilla Minecraft rules.When changing an existing mob use the ID that appears in the entity JSON for that entity. When creating your own mob, make sure the mobs have the same ID in all the entity's JSON files.

Spawn Rules also needs to define the pool that is used for population control.Each pool has their own spawn limit, By setting an entity to a pool it will spawn as long as that pool hasn't reached the spawn limit.
There are 3 pools that entities can be assigned to :
-animal
-water_animal
-monster

sections.name: Tagged Biomes

rows.Tags: animal, monster, forest, birch, mutated, hills
animal, monster, taiga, mega, hills, mutated

content: Example Spawn Rules for the zombie
"format_version": "1.8.0",
"minecraft:spawn_rules": {
"description": {
"identifier": "minecraft:zombie",
"population_control": "monster"
"conditions": [
"minecraft:spawns_on_surface": {},
"minecraft:brightness_filter": {
"adjust_for_weather": true
"minecraft:difficulty_filter": {
"min": "easy",
"max": "hard"
"minecraft:weight": {
"default": 100
"minecraft:herd": {
"min_size": 2,
"max_size": 4
"minecraft:permute_type": [
"weight": 95
"weight": 5,
"entity_type": "minecraft:zombie_villager"
"minecraft:biome_filter": {
"test": "has_biome_tag", "operator": "==", "value": "monster"

sections.name: Filters
content: Filters allow data objects to specify test criteria which allows their use.
For example, a model that includes a filter will only be used when the filter criteria is true.
A typical filter consists of four parameters:
name: the name of the test to apply.
domain: the domain the test should be performed in. An armor slot, for example. This parameter is only used by a few tests.
operator: the comparison to apply with the value, such as 'equal' or 'greater'.
value: the value being compared with the test.
A typical filter looks like the following:
{ "test" : "moon_intensity", "subject" : "self", "operator" : "greater", "value" : "0.5" }
Which results in the calling entity (self) calculating the moon_intensity at its location and returning true if the result is greater than 0.5.
Tests can be combined into groups using the collections 'all_of', 'any_of', or 'none_of'.
All tests in an 'all_of' group must pass in order for the group to pass.
One or more tests in an 'any_of' group must pass in order for the group to pass.
All tests in a 'none_of' group must fail in order for the group to pass.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.admire_item
content: Enables the mob to admire items that have been configured as admirable. Must be used in combination with the admire_item component

rows.Name: admire_item_sound
rows.Description: The sound event to play when admiring the item

rows.Name: sound_interval
rows.Description: The range of time in seconds to randomly wait before playing the sound again.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.avoid_block (See JSON Schema since 1.21.120)
content: Allows this entity to avoid certain blocks.

rows.Name: avoid_block_sound
rows.Description: The sound event to play when the mob is avoiding a block.

rows.Name: on_escape
rows.Description: Escape trigger.

rows.Name: search_height
rows.Description: Maximum distance to look for a block in y.

rows.Name: search_range
rows.Description: Maximum distance to look for a block in xz.

rows.Name: sound_interval
rows.Description: The range of time in seconds to randomly wait before playing the sound again.

rows.Name: sprint_speed_modifier
rows.Description: Modifier for sprint speed. 1.0 means keep the regular speed, while higher numbers make the sprint speed faster.

rows.Name: target_blocks
rows.Description: List of block types this mob avoids.

rows.Name: target_selection_method
rows.Description: Block search method.

rows.Name: tick_interval
rows.Description: Should start tick interval.

rows.Name: walk_speed_modifier
rows.Description: Modifier for walking speed. 1.0 means keep the regular speed, while higher numbers make the walking speed faster.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.avoid_mob_type (See JSON Schema since 1.21.120)
content: Allows the entity to run away from other entities that meet the criteria specified.

rows.Name: avoid_mob_sound
rows.Description: The sound event to play when the mob is avoiding another mob.

rows.Name: avoid_target_xz
rows.Description: The next target position the entity chooses to avoid another entity will be chosen within this XZ Distance.

rows.Name: avoid_target_y
rows.Description: The next target position the entity chooses to avoid another entity will be chosen within this Y Distance.

rows.Name: entity_types
rows.Description: The list of conditions another entity must meet to be a valid target to avoid.

rows.Name: ignore_visibility
rows.Description: Whether or not to ignore direct line of sight while this entity is running away from other specified entities.

rows.Name: max_dist
rows.Description: Maximum distance to look for an avoid target for the entity.

rows.Name: max_flee
rows.Description: How many blocks away from its avoid target the entity must be for it to stop fleeing from the avoid target.

rows.Name: on_escape_event
rows.Description: Event that is triggered when escaping from a mob.

rows.Name: probability_per_strength
rows.Description: Percent chance this entity will stop avoiding another entity based on that entity's strength, where 1.0 = 100%.

rows.Name: remove_target
rows.Description: Determine if we should remove target when fleeing or not.

rows.Name: sound_interval
rows.Description: The range of time in seconds to randomly wait before playing the sound again.

rows.Name: sprint_distance
rows.Description: How many blocks within range of its avoid target the entity must be for it to begin sprinting away from the avoid target.

rows.Name: sprint_speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Multiplier for sprint speed. 1.0 means keep the regular speed, while higher numbers make the sprint speed faster.

rows.Name: walk_speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Multiplier for walking speed. 1.0 means keep the regular speed, while higher numbers make the walking speed faster.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.barter
content: Enables the mob to barter for items that have been configured as barter currency. Must be used in combination with the barter component

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.beg
content: Allows this mob to look at and follow the player that holds food they like.

rows.Name: items
rows.Description: List of items that this mob likes

rows.Name: look_distance
rows.Description: Distance in blocks the mob will beg from

rows.Name: look_time
rows.Description: The range of time in seconds this mob will stare at the player holding a food they like, begging for it

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.break_door
content: Allows this mob to break doors.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.breed
content: Allows this mob to breed with other mobs.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.celebrate
content: Allows this entity to celebrate surviving a raid by making celebration sounds and jumping.

rows.Name: celebration_sound
rows.Description: The sound event to trigger during the celebration.

rows.Name: duration
rows.Description: The duration in seconds that the celebration lasts for.

rows.Name: jump_interval
rows.Description: Minimum and maximum time between jumping (positive, in seconds).

rows.Name: on_celebration_end_event
rows.Description: The event to trigger when the goal's duration expires.

rows.Name: sound_interval
rows.Description: Minimum and maximum time between sound events (positive, in seconds).

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.celebrate_survive
content: Allows this entity to celebrate surviving a raid by shooting fireworks.

rows.Name: duration
rows.Description: The duration in seconds that the celebration lasts for.

rows.Name: fireworks_interval
rows.Description: Minimum and maximum time between firework (positive, in seconds).

rows.Name: on_celebration_end_event
rows.Description: The event to trigger when the goal's duration expires.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.charge_attack (See JSON Schema since 1.21.100)
content: Allows this entity to damage a target by using a running attack.

rows.Name: max_distance
rows.Description: A charge attack cannot start if the entity is farther than this distance to the target.

rows.Name: min_distance
rows.Description: A charge attack cannot start if the entity is closer than this distance to the target.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Modifies the entity's speed when charging toward the target.

rows.Name: success_rate
rows.Description: Percent chance this entity will start a charge attack, if not already attacking (1.0 = 100%)

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.charge_held_item
content: Allows an entity to charge and use their held item.

rows.Name: items
rows.Description: The list of items that can be used to charge the held item. This list is required and must have at least one item in it.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.circle_around_anchor (See JSON Schema since 1.21.100)
content: Causes an entity to circle around an anchor point placed near a point or target.

rows.Name: angle_change
rows.Description: Number of degrees to change this entity's facing by, when the entity selects its next anchor point.

rows.Name: goal_radius
rows.Description: Maximum distance from the anchor-point in which this entity considers itself to have reached the anchor point. This is to prevent the entity from bouncing back and forth trying to reach a specific spot.

rows.Name: height_above_target_range
rows.Description: The number of blocks above the target that the next anchor point can be set. This value is used only when the entity is tracking a target.

rows.Name: height_adjustment_chance
rows.Description: Percent chance to determine how often to increase or decrease the current height around the anchor point. 1 = 100%. "height_change_chance" is deprecated and has been replaced with "height_adjustment_chance".

rows.Name: height_offset_range
rows.Description: Vertical distance from the anchor point this entity must stay within, upon a successful height adjustment.

rows.Name: radius_adjustment_chance
rows.Description: Percent chance to determine how often to increase the size of the current movement radius around the anchor point. 1 = 100%. "radius_change_chance" is deprecated and has been replaced with "radius_adjustment_chance".

rows.Name: radius_change
rows.Description: The number of blocks to increase the current movement radius by, upon successful "radius_adjustment_chance". If the current radius increases over the range maximum, the current radius will be set back to the range minimum and the entity will change between clockwise and counter-clockwise movement..

rows.Name: radius_range
rows.Description: Horizontal distance from the anchor point this entity must stay within upon a successful radius adjustment.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Multiplies the speed at which this entity travels to its next desired position.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.controlled_by_player (See JSON Schema since 1.21.100)
content: Allows the entity to be controlled by the player using an item in the item_controllable property (required). Also requires the minecraft:movement property, and the minecraft:rideable property. On every tick, the entity will attempt to rotate towards where the player is facing with the control item whilst simultaneously moving forward.

rows.Name: fractional_rotation
rows.Description: The entity will attempt to rotate to face where the player is facing each tick. The entity will target this percentage of their difference in their current facing angles each tick (from 0.0 to 1.0 where 1.0 = 100%). This is limited by FractionalRotationLimit. A value of 0.0 will result in the entity no longer turning to where the player is facing.

rows.Name: fractional_rotation_limit
rows.Description: Limits the total degrees the entity can rotate to face where the player is facing on each tick.

rows.Name: mount_speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Speed multiplier of mount when controlled by player.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.croak
content: Allows the entity to croak at a random time interval with configurable conditions.

rows.Name: duration
rows.Description: Random range in seconds after which the croaking stops. Can also be a constant.

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: Conditions for the behavior to start and keep running. The interval between runs only starts after passing the filters.

rows.Name: interval
rows.Description: Random range in seconds between runs of this behavior. Can also be a constant.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.defend_trusted_target
content: Allows the mob to target another mob that hurts an entity it trusts.

rows.Name: aggro_sound
rows.Description: Sound to occasionally play while defending.

rows.Name: attack_interval
rows.Description: Time in seconds between attacks

rows.Name: entity_types
Description: List of entity types that this mob considers valid targets

rows.Name: cooldown
rows.Description: The amount of time in seconds that the mob has to wait before selecting a target of the same type again

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: Conditions that make this entry in the list valid

rows.Name: max_dist
rows.Description: Maximum distance this mob can be away to be a valid choice

rows.Name: must_see
rows.Description: If true, the mob has to be visible to be a valid choice

rows.Name: must_see_forget_duration
rows.Description: Determines the amount of time in seconds that this mob will look for a target before forgetting about it and looking for a new one when the target isn't visible any more

rows.Name: reevaluate_description
rows.Description: If true, the mob will stop being targeted if it stops meeting any conditions.

rows.Name: sprint_speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Multiplier for the running speed. A value of 1.0 means the speed is unchanged

rows.Name: walk_speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Multiplier for the walking speed. A value of 1.0 means the speed is unchanged

rows.Name: must_see
rows.Description: If true, only entities in this mob's viewing range can be selected as targets

rows.Name: must_see_forget_duration
rows.Description: Determines the amount of time in seconds that this mob will look for a target before forgetting about it and looking for a new one when the target isn't visible any more

rows.Name: within_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks that the target can be within to launch an attack

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.defend_village_target
content: Allows the entity to stay in a village and defend the village from aggressors. If a player is in bad standing with the village this goal will cause the entity to attack the player regardless of filter conditions.

rows.Name: attack_chance
rows.Description: The percentage chance that the entity has to attack aggressors of its village, where 1.0 = 100%.

rows.Name: attack_owner
rows.Description: If true, this entity can attack its owner.

rows.Name: entity_types
rows.Description: Filters which types of targets are valid for this entity.

rows.Name: must_reach
rows.Description: If true, this entity requires a path to the target.

rows.Name: must_see
rows.Description: Determines if target-validity requires this entity to be in range only, or both in range and in sight.

rows.Name: must_see_forget_duration
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) the target must not be seen by this entity to become invalid. Used only if "must_see" is true.

rows.Name: persist_time
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) this entity can continue attacking the target after the target is no longer valid.

rows.Name: within_radius
rows.Description: Maximum distance this entity can be from the target when following it, otherwise the target becomes invalid. This value is only used if the entity doesn't declare "minecraft:follow_range".

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.delayed_attack
content: Allows an entity to attack, while also delaying the damage-dealt until a specific time in the attack animation.

rows.Name: attack_duration
rows.Description: The entity's attack animation will play out over this duration (in seconds). Also controls attack cooldown.

rows.Name: attack_once
rows.Description: Allows the entity to use this attack behavior, only once EVER.

rows.Name: attack_types
rows.Description: Defines the entity types this entity will attack.

rows.Name: can_spread_on_fire
rows.Description: If the entity is on fire, this allows the entity's target to catch on fire after being hit.

rows.Name: hit_delay_pct
rows.Description: The percentage into the attack animation to apply the damage of the attack (1.0 = 100%).

rows.Name: inner_boundary_time_increase
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) to add to attack path recalculation when the target is beyond the "path_inner_boundary".

rows.Name: max_path_time
rows.Description: Maximum base time (in seconds) to recalculate new attack path to target (before increases applied).

rows.Name: melee_fov
rows.Description: Field of view (in degrees) when using the sensing component to detect an attack target.

rows.Name: min_path_time
rows.Description: Minimum base time (in seconds) to recalculate new attack path to target (before increases applied).

rows.Name: on_attack
rows.Description: Defines the event to trigger when this entity successfully attacks.

rows.Name: on_kill
rows.Description: Defines the event to trigger when this entity kills the target.

rows.Name: outer_boundary_time_increase
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) to add to attack path recalculation when the target is beyond the "path_outer_boundary".

rows.Name: path_fail_time_increase
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) to add to attack path recalculation when this entity cannot move along the current path.

rows.Name: path_inner_boundary
rows.Description: Distance at which to increase attack path recalculation by "inner_boundary_tick_increase".

rows.Name: path_outer_boundary
rows.Description: Distance at which to increase attack path recalculation by "outer_boundary_tick_increase".

rows.Name: random_stop_interval
rows.Description: This entity will have a 1 in N chance to stop it's current attack, where N = "random_stop_interval".

rows.Name: reach_multiplier
rows.Description: Used with the base size of the entity to determine minimum target-distance before trying to deal attack damage.

rows.Name: require_complete_path
rows.Description: Toggles (on/off) the need to have a full path from the entity to the target when using this melee attack behavior.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: This multiplier modifies the attacking entity's speed when moving toward the target.

rows.Name: track_target
rows.Description: Allows the entity to track the attack target, even if the entity has no sensing.

rows.Name: x_max_rotation
rows.Description: Maximum rotation (in degrees), on the X-axis, this entity can rotate while trying to look at the target.

rows.Name: y_max_head_rotation
rows.Description: Maximum rotation (in degrees), on the Y-axis, this entity can rotate its head while trying to look at the target.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.dig (See JSON Schema since 1.21.120)
content: Allows this entity to dig into the ground before despawning.

rows.Name: allow_dig_when_named
rows.Description: If true, this behavior can run when this entity is named. Otherwise not.

rows.Name: digs_in_daylight
rows.Description: Indicates that the actor should start digging when it sees daylight

rows.Name: duration
rows.Description: Goal duration in seconds

rows.Name: idle_time
rows.Description: The minimum idle time in seconds between the last detected disturbance to the start of digging.

rows.Name: on_start
rows.Description: Event(s) to run when the goal starts.

rows.Name: suspicion_is_disturbance
rows.Description: If true, finding new suspicious locations count as disturbances that may delay the start of this goal.

rows.Name: vibration_is_disturbance
rows.Description: If true, vibrations count as disturbances that may delay the start of this goal.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.door_interact
content: Allows the mob to open and close doors.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.dragonchargeplayer
content: Allows this entity to attack a player by charging at them. The player is chosen by the "minecraft:behavior.dragonscanning". Can only be used by the Ender Dragon.

rows.Name: active_speed
rows.Description: The speed this entity moves when this behavior has started or while it's active.

rows.Name: continue_charge_threshold_time
rows.Description: If the dragon is outside the "target_zone" for longer than "continue_charge_threshold_time" seconds, the charge is canceled.

rows.Name: flight_speed
rows.Description: The speed this entity moves while this behavior is not active.

rows.Name: target_zone
rows.Description: Minimum and maximum distance, from the target, this entity can use this behavior.

rows.Name: turn_speed
rows.Description: The speed at which this entity turns while using this behavior.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.dragondeath
content: Allows the dragon to go out with glory. This controls the Ender Dragon's death animation and can't be used by other mobs.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.dragonflaming (See JSON Schema since 1.21.100)
content: Allows this entity to use a flame-breath attack. Can only be used by the Ender Dragon.

rows.Name: cooldown_time
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) between each start of the cycle to roar, then breath flame.

rows.Name: flame_time
rows.Description: Time (in seconds), after roar, to breath flame.

rows.Name: ground_flame_count
rows.Description: Number of ground flame-breath attacks to use before flight-takeoff.

rows.Name: roar_time
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) to roar, before breathing flame.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.dragonholdingpattern
content: Allows the Dragon to fly around in a circle around the center podium. Can only be used by the Ender Dragon.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.dragonlanding
content: Allows the Dragon to stop flying and transition into perching mode. Can only be used by the Ender Dragon.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.dragonscanning
content: Allows the dragon to look around for a player to attack while in perch mode. Can only be used by the Ender Dragon.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.dragonstrafeplayer
content: Allows this entity to fly around looking for a player to shoot fireballs at. Can only be used by the Ender Dragon.

rows.Name: active_speed
rows.Description: The speed this entity moves when this behavior has started or while it's active.

rows.Name: fireball_range
rows.Description: Maximum distance of this entity's fireball attack while strafing.

rows.Name: flight_speed
rows.Description: The speed this entity moves while this behavior is not active.

rows.Name: switch_direction_probability
rows.Description: Percent chance to to switch this entity's strafe direction between clockwise and counterclockwise. Switch direction chance occurs each time a new target is chosen (1.0 = 100%).

rows.Name: target_in_range_and_in_view_time
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) the target must be in fireball range, and in view [ie, no solid terrain in-between the target and this entity], before a fireball can be shot.

rows.Name: target_zone
rows.Description: Minimum and maximum distance, from the target, this entity can use this behavior.

rows.Name: turn_speed
rows.Description: The speed at which this entity turns while using this behavior.

rows.Name: view_angle
rows.Description: The target must be within "view_angle" degrees of the dragon's current rotation before a fireball can be shot.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.dragontakeoff
content: Allows the dragon to leave perch mode and go back to flying around. Can only be used by the Ender Dragon.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.drink_milk (See JSON Schema since 1.21.120)
content: Allows the mob to drink milk based on specified environment conditions.

rows.Name: cooldown_seconds
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) that the goal is on cooldown before it can be used again.

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: Conditions that need to be met for the behavior to start.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.drink_potion
content: Allows the mob to drink potions based on specified environment conditions.

rows.Name: potions
Description: A list of potions that this entity can drink. Each potion entry has the following parameters:

rows.Name: chance
rows.Description: The percent chance (from 0.0 to 1.0) of this potion being selected when searching for a potion to use.

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: The filters to use when determining if this potion can be selected.

rows.Name: id
rows.Description: The registry ID of the potion to use

rows.Name: speed_modifier
rows.Description: The movement speed modifier to apply to the entity while it is drinking a potion. A value of 0 represents no change in speed.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.drop_item_for
content: Allows the entity to move toward a target, and drop an item near the target. This goal requires a "minecraft:navigation" to execute.

rows.Name: cooldown
rows.Description: Total time that the goal is on cooldown before it can be used again.

rows.Name: drop_item_chance
rows.Description: The percent chance the entity will drop an item when using this goal.

rows.Name: entity_types
rows.Description: The list of conditions another entity must meet to be a valid target to drop an item for.

rows.Name: goal_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks within the entity considers it has reached it's target position.

rows.Name: loot_table
rows.Description: The loot table that contains the possible loot the entity can drop with this goal.

rows.Name: max_head_look_at_height
rows.Description: The maximum height the entities head will look at when dropping the item. The entity will always be looking at its target.

rows.Name: minimum_teleport_distance
rows.Description: If the target position is farther away than this distance on any tick, the entity will teleport to the target position.

rows.Name: offering_distance
rows.Description: The preferred distance the entity tries to be from the target it is dropping an item for.

rows.Name: on_drop_attempt
rows.Description: The event to trigger when the entity attempts to drop an item.

rows.Name: search_count
rows.Description: The number of blocks each tick that the entity will check within its search range and height for a valid block to move to. A value of 0 will have the mob check every block within range in one tick.

rows.Name: search_height
rows.Description: The Height in blocks the entity will search within to find a valid target position.

rows.Name: search_range
rows.Description: The distance in blocks the entity will search within to find a valid target position.

rows.Name: seconds_before_pickup
rows.Description: The numbers of seconds that will pass before the dropped entity can be picked up from the ground.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the entity when using this Goal.

rows.Name: target_range
rows.Description: The range in blocks within which the entity searches to find a target to drop an item for.

rows.Name: teleport_offset
rows.Description: When the entity teleports, offset the teleport position by this many blocks in the X, Y, and Z coordinate.

rows.Name: time_of_day_range
rows.Description: The valid times of day that this goal can be used. For reference: noon is 0.0, sunset is 0.25, midnight is 0.5, and sunrise is 0.75, and back to noon for 1.0.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.eat_block
content: Allows the entity to consume a block, replace the eaten block with another block, and trigger an event as a result.

rows.Name: eat_and_replace_block_pairs
rows.Description: A collection of pairs of blocks; the first ("eat_block")is the block the entity should eat, the second ("replace_block") is the block that should replace the eaten block.

rows.Name: on_eat
rows.Description: The event to trigger when the block eating animation has completed.

rows.Name: success_chance
rows.Description: A molang expression defining the success chance the entity has to consume a block.

rows.Name: time_until_eat
rows.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) it takes for the block to be eaten upon a successful eat attempt.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.eat_carried_item
content: If the mob is carrying a food item, the mob will eat it and the effects will be applied to the mob.

rows.Name: delay_before_eating
rows.Description: Time in seconds the mob should wait before eating the item.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.eat_mob (See JSON Schema since 1.21.100)
content: Allows the entity to eat a specified Mob.

rows.Name: eat_animation_time
rows.Description: Sets the time in seconds the eat animation should play for.

rows.Name: eat_mob_sound
rows.Description: Sets the sound that should play when eating a mob.

rows.Name: loot_table
rows.Description: The loot table for loot to be dropped when eating a mob.

rows.Name: pull_in_force
rows.Description: Sets the force which the mob-to-be-eaten is pulled towards the eating mob.

rows.Name: reach_mob_distance
rows.Description: Sets the desired distance to be reached before eating the mob.

rows.Name: run_speed
rows.Description: Sets the entity's speed when running toward the target.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.emerge
content: Allows this entity to emerge from the ground

rows.Name: cooldown_time
rows.Description: Time in seconds the mob has to wait before using the goal again

rows.Name: duration
rows.Description: Goal duration in seconds

rows.Name: on_done
rows.Description: Trigger to be executed when the goal execution is about to end

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.enderman_leave_block
content: Allows the enderman to drop a block they are carrying. Can only be used by Endermen.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.enderman_take_block
content: Allows the enderman to take a block and carry it around. Can only be used by Endermen.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.equip_item
content: The entity puts on the desired equipment.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.explore_outskirts (See JSON Schema since 1.21.130)
content: Allows the entity to first travel to a random point on the outskirts of the village, and then explore random points within a small distance. This goal requires "minecraft:dweller" and "minecraft:navigation" to execute.

rows.Name: dist_from_boundary
rows.Description: The distance from the boundary the villager must be within in to explore the outskirts.

rows.Name: explore_dist
rows.Description: Total distance in blocks the the entity will explore beyond the village bounds when choosing its travel point.

rows.Name: max_travel_time
rows.Description: This is the maximum amount of time an entity will attempt to reach it's travel point on the outskirts of the village before the goal exits.

rows.Name: max_wait_time
rows.Description: The wait time in seconds between choosing new explore points will be chosen on a random interval between this value and the minimum wait time. This value is also the total amount of time the entity will explore random points before the goal stops.

rows.Name: min_dist_from_target
rows.Description: The entity must be within this distance for it to consider it has successfully reached its target.

rows.Name: min_perimeter
rows.Description: The minimum perimeter of the village required to run this goal.

rows.Name: min_wait_time
rows.Description: The wait time in seconds between choosing new explore points will be chosen on a random interval between this value and the maximum wait time.

rows.Name: next_xz
rows.Description: A new explore point will randomly be chosen within this XZ distance of the current target position when navigation has finished and the wait timer has elapsed.

rows.Name: next_y
rows.Description: A new explore point will randomly be chosen within this Y distance of the current target position when navigation has finished and the wait timer has elapsed.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: The multiplier for speed while using this goal. 1.0 maintains the speed.

rows.Name: timer_ratio
rows.Description: Each new explore point will be chosen on a random interval between the minimum and the maximum wait time, divided by this value. This does not apply to the first explore point chosen when the goal runs.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.fertilize_farm_block
content: Allows the mob to search within an area for a growable crop block. If found, the mob will use any available fertilizer in their inventory on the crop. This goal will not execute if the mob does not have a fertilizer item in its inventory.

rows.Name: goal_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks within the mob considers it has reached it's target position.

rows.Name: max_fertilizer_usage
rows.Description: The maximum number of times the mob will use fertilzer on the target block.

rows.Name: search_cooldown_max_seconds
rows.Description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the goal can take before searching again. The time is chosen between 0 and this number.

rows.Name: search_count
rows.Description: The number of randomly selected blocks each tick that the mob will check within its search range and height for a valid block to move to. A value of 0 will have the mob check every block within range in one tick.

rows.Name: search_height
rows.Description: The Height in blocks the mob will search within to find a valid target position.

rows.Name: search_range
rows.Description: The distance in blocks the mob will search within to find a valid target position.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this Goal.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.find_cover
content: Allows the mob to seek shade.

rows.Name: cooldown_time
rows.Description: Time in seconds the mob has to wait before using the goal again

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.find_mount
content: Allows the mob to look around for another mob to ride atop it.

rows.Name: avoid_water
rows.Description: If true, the mob will not go into water blocks when going towards a mount

rows.Name: mount_distance
rows.Description: This is the distance the mob needs to be, in blocks, from the desired mount to mount it. If the value is below 0, the mob will use its default attack distance

rows.Name: start_delay
rows.Description: Time the mob will wait before starting to move towards the mount

rows.Name: target_needed
rows.Description: If true, the mob will only look for a mount if it has a target

rows.Name: within_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks within which the mob will look for a mount

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.find_underwater_treasure
content: Allows the mob to move towards the nearest underwater ruin or shipwreck.

rows.Name: search_range
rows.Description: The range that the mob will search for a treasure chest within a ruin or shipwreck to move towards.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

rows.Name: stop_distance
rows.Description: The distance the mob will move before stopping.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.fire_at_target
content: Allows an entity to attack by firing a shot with a delay. Anchor and offset parameters of this component overrides the anchor and offset from projectile component.

rows.Name: attack_cooldown
rows.Description: The cooldown time in seconds before this goal can be used again.

rows.Name: attack_range
rows.Description: Target needs to be within this range for the attack to happen.

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: Conditions that need to be met for the behavior to start.

rows.Name: max_head_rotation_x
rows.Description: Maximum head rotation (in degrees), on the X-axis, that this entity can apply while trying to look at the target.

rows.Name: max_head_rotation_y
rows.Description: Maximum head rotation (in degrees), on the Y-axis, that this entity can apply while trying to look at the target.

rows.Name: owner_anchor
rows.Description: Entity anchor for the projectile spawn location.

rows.Name: owner_offset
rows.Description: Offset vector from the owner_anchor.

rows.Name: post_shoot_delay
rows.Description: Time in seconds between firing the projectile and ending the goal.

rows.Name: pre_shoot_delay
rows.Description: Time in seconds before firing the projectile.

rows.Name: projectile_def
rows.Description: Actor definition to use as projectile for the ranged attack. The actor must be a projectile. This field is required for the goal to be usable.

rows.Name: ranged_fov
rows.Description: Field of view (in degrees) when using sensing to detect a target for attack.

rows.Name: target_anchor
rows.Description: Entity anchor for projectile target.

rows.Name: target_offset
rows.Description: Offset vector from the target_anchor.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.flee_sun
content: Allows the mob to run away from direct sunlight and seek shade.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.float
content: Allows the mob to stay afloat while swimming. Passengers will be kicked out the moment the mob's head goes underwater, which may not happen for tall mobs.

rows.Name: sink_with_passengers
rows.Description: If true, the mob will keep sinking as long as it has passengers.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.float_tempt
content: Allows a mob to be tempted by a player holding a specific item. Uses point-to-point movement. Designed for mobs that are floating (e.g. use the "minecraft:navigation.float" component).

rows.Name: can_get_scared
rows.Description: If true, the mob can stop being tempted if the player moves too fast while close to this mob.

rows.Name: can_tempt_vertically
rows.Description: If true, vertical distance to the player will be considered when tempting.

rows.Name: can_tempt_while_ridden
rows.Description: If true, the mob can be tempted even if it has a passenger (i.e. if being ridden).

rows.Name: items
rows.Description: List of items that can tempt the mob.

rows.Name: sound_interval
rows.Description: Range of random ticks to wait between tempt sounds.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

rows.Name: stop_distance
rows.Description: The distance at which the mob will stop following the player.

rows.Name: tempt_sound
rows.Description: Sound to play while the mob is being tempted.

rows.Name: within_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks this mob can get tempted by a player holding an item they like.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.float_wander
content: Allows the mob to float around like the Ghast.

rows.Name: additional_collision_buffer
rows.Description: If true, the mob will have an additional buffer zone around it to avoid collisions with blocks when picking a position to wander to.

rows.Name: allow_navigating_through_liquids
rows.Description: If true allows the mob to navigate through liquids on its way to the target position.

rows.Name: float_duration
rows.Description: Range of time in seconds the mob will float around before landing and choosing to do something else

rows.Name: float_wander_has_move_control
rows.Description: If true, the MoveControl flag will be added to the behavior which means that it can no longer be active at the same time as other behaviors with MoveControl.

rows.Name: must_reach
rows.Description: If true, the point has to be reachable to be a valid target

rows.Name: navigate_around_surface
rows.Description: If true, will prioritize finding random positions in the vicinity of surfaces, i.e. blocks that are not Air or Liquid.

rows.Name: random_reselect
rows.Description: If true, the mob will randomly pick a new point while moving to the previously selected one

rows.Name: surface_xz_dist
rows.Description: The horizontal distance in blocks that the goal will check for a surface from a candidate position. Only valid when `navigate_around_surface` is true.

rows.Name: surface_y_dist
rows.Description: The vertical distance in blocks that the goal will check for a surface from a candidate position. Only valid when `navigate_around_surface` is true.

rows.Name: use_home_position_restriction
rows.Description: If true, the mob will respect home position restrictions when choosing new target positions. If false, it will choose target position without considering home restrictions

rows.Name: xz_dist
rows.Description: Distance in blocks on ground that the mob will look for a new spot to move to. Must be at least 1

rows.Name: y_dist
rows.Description: Distance in blocks that the mob will look up or down for a new spot to move to. Must be at least 1

rows.Name: y_offset
rows.Description: Height in blocks to add to the selected target position

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.follow_caravan
content: Allows the mob to follow mobs that are in a caravan.

rows.Name: entity_count
rows.Description: Number of entities that can be in the caravan

rows.Name: entity_types
Description: List of entity types that this mob can follow in a caravan

rows.Name: cooldown
rows.Description: The amount of time in seconds that the mob has to wait before selecting a target of the same type again

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: Conditions that make this entry in the list valid

rows.Name: max_dist
rows.Description: Maximum distance this mob can be away to be a valid choice

rows.Name: must_see
rows.Description: If true, the mob has to be visible to be a valid choice

rows.Name: must_see_forget_duration
rows.Description: Determines the amount of time in seconds that this mob will look for a target before forgetting about it and looking for a new one when the target isn't visible any more

rows.Name: reevaluate_description
rows.Description: If true, the mob will stop being targeted if it stops meeting any conditions.

rows.Name: sprint_speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Multiplier for the running speed. A value of 1.0 means the speed is unchanged

rows.Name: walk_speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Multiplier for the walking speed. A value of 1.0 means the speed is unchanged

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.follow_mob
content: Allows the mob to follow other mobs.

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: If non-empty, provides criteria for filtering which nearby Mobs can be followed. If empty default criteria will be used, which will exclude Players, Squid variants, Fish variants, Tadpoles, Dolphins, and mobs of the same type as the owner of the Goal.

rows.Name: preferred_actor_type
rows.Description: The type of actor to prefer following. If left unspecified, a random actor among those in range will be chosen.

rows.Name: search_range
rows.Description: The distance in blocks it will look for a mob to follow

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

rows.Name: stop_distance
rows.Description: The distance in blocks this mob stops from the mob it is following

rows.Name: use_home_position_restriction
rows.Description: If true, the mob will respect the 'minecraft:home' component's 'restriction_radius' field when choosing a target to follow. If false, it will choose target position without considering home restrictions.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.follow_owner
content: Allows a mob to follow the player that owns it.

rows.Name: can_teleport
rows.Description: Defines if the mob will teleport to its owner when too far away.

rows.Name: ignore_vibration
rows.Description: Defines if the mob should disregard following its owner after detecting a recent vibration.

rows.Name: max_distance
rows.Description: The maximum distance the mob can be from its owner to start following it. Applicable only when "can_teleport" is set to false.

rows.Name: post_teleport_distance
rows.Description: Defines how far (in blocks) the entity will be from its owner after teleporting. If not specified, it defaults to "stop_distance" + 1, allowing the entity to seamlessly resume navigation.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

rows.Name: start_distance
rows.Description: The minimum distance the mob must be from its owner to start following it.

rows.Name: stop_distance
rows.Description: The distance at which the mob will stop following its owner.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.follow_parent
content: Allows the mob to follow their parent around.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.follow_target_captain
content: Allows mob to move towards its current target captain.

rows.Name: follow_distance
rows.Description: Defines the distance in blocks the mob will stay from its target while following.

rows.Name: within_radius
rows.Description: Defines the maximum distance in blocks a mob can get from its target captain before giving up trying to follow it.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.go_and_give_items_to_noteblock
content: The entity will attempt to toss the items from its inventory to a nearby recently played noteblock.

rows.Name: listen_time
rows.Description: Sets the time an entity should continue delivering items to a noteblock after hearing it.

rows.Name: on_item_throw
rows.Description: Event(s) to run when this mob throws items.

rows.Name: reach_block_distance
rows.Description: Sets the desired distance to be reached before throwing the items towards the block.

rows.Name: run_speed
rows.Description: Sets the entity's speed when running toward the block.

rows.Name: throw_force
rows.Description: Sets the throw force.

rows.Name: throw_sound
rows.Description: Sound to play when this mob throws an item.

rows.Name: vertical_throw_mul
rows.Description: Sets the vertical throw multiplier that is applied on top of the throw force in the vertical direction.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.go_and_give_items_to_owner
content: The entity will attempt to toss the items from its inventory to its owner.

rows.Name: on_item_throw
rows.Description: Event(s) to run when this mob throws items.

rows.Name: reach_mob_distance
rows.Description: Sets the desired distance to be reached before giving items to owner.

rows.Name: run_speed
rows.Description: Sets the entity's speed when running toward the owner.

rows.Name: throw_force
rows.Description: Sets the throw force.

rows.Name: throw_sound
rows.Description: Sound to play when this mob throws an item.

rows.Name: vertical_throw_mul
rows.Description: Sets the vertical throw multiplier that is applied on top of the throw force in the vertical direction.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.go_home
content: Allows the mob to move back to the position they were spawned.

rows.Name: calculate_new_path_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks that the mob is considered close enough to the end of the current path. A new path will then be calculated to continue toward home.

rows.Name: goal_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks within the mob considers it has reached the goal. This is the "wiggle room" to stop the AI from bouncing back and forth trying to reach a specific spot.

rows.Name: interval
rows.Description: A random value to determine when to randomly move somewhere. This has a 1/interval chance to choose this goal.

rows.Name: on_failed
rows.Description: Event(s) to run when this goal fails.

rows.Name: on_home
rows.Description: Event(s) to run when this mob gets home.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.guardian_attack
content: Allows this entity to use a laser beam attack. Can only be used by Guardians and Elder Guardians.

rows.Name: elder_extra_magic_damage
rows.Description: Amount of additional damage dealt from an elder guardian's magic attack.

rows.Name: hard_mode_extra_magic_damage
rows.Description: In hard difficulty, amount of additional damage dealt from a guardian's magic attack.

rows.Name: magic_damage
rows.Description: Amount of damage dealt from a guardian's magic attack. Magic attack damage is added to the guardian's base attack damage.

rows.Name: min_distance
rows.Description: Guardian attack behavior stops if the target is closer than this distance (doesn't apply to elders).

rows.Name: sound_delay_time
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) to wait after starting an attack before playing the guardian attack sound.

rows.Name: x_max_rotation
rows.Description: Maximum rotation (in degrees), on the X-axis, this entity can rotate while trying to look at the target.

rows.Name: y_max_head_rotation
rows.Description: Maximum rotation (in degrees), on the Y-axis, this entity can rotate its head while trying to look at the target.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.harvest_farm_block
content: Allows the entity to search within an area for farmland with air above it. If found, the entity will replace the air block by planting a seed item from its inventory on the farmland block. This goal requires "minecraft:inventory" and "minecraft:navigation" to execute. This goal will not execute if the entity does not have an item in its inventory.

rows.Name: goal_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks within the entity considers it has reached it's target position.

rows.Name: max_seconds_before_search
rows.Description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the goal can take before searching for the first harvest block. The time is chosen between 0 and this number.

rows.Name: search_cooldown_max_seconds
rows.Description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the goal can take before searching again, after failing to find a a harvest block already. The time is chosen between 0 and this number.

rows.Name: search_count
rows.Description: The number of randomly selected blocks each tick that the entity will check within its search range and height for a valid block to move to. A value of 0 will have the mob check every block within range in one tick.

rows.Name: search_height
rows.Description: The Height in blocks the entity will search within to find a valid target position.

rows.Name: search_range
rows.Description: The distance in blocks the entity will search within to find a valid target position.

rows.Name: seconds_until_new_task
rows.Description: The amount of time in seconds that the goal will cooldown after a successful reap/sow, before it can start again.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the entity when using this Goal.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.hide
content: Allows a mob with the hide component to attempt to move to - and hide at - an owned or nearby POI.

rows.Name: duration
rows.Description: Amount of time in seconds that the mob reacts.

rows.Name: poi_type
rows.Description: Defines what POI type to hide at.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

rows.Name: timeout_cooldown
rows.Description: The cooldown time in seconds before the goal can be reused after a internal failure or timeout condition.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.hold_ground
content: The mob freezes and looks at the mob they are targeting.

rows.Name: broadcast
rows.Description: Whether to broadcast out the mob's target to other mobs of the same type.

rows.Name: broadcast_range
rows.Description: Range in blocks for how far to broadcast.

rows.Name: min_radius
rows.Description: Minimum distance the target must be for the mob to run this goal.

rows.Name: within_radius_event
rows.Description: Event to run when target is within the radius. This event is broadcasted if broadcast is true.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.hurt_by_target
content: Allows the mob to target another mob that hurts them.

rows.Name: alert_same_type
rows.Description: If true, nearby mobs of the same type will be alerted about the damage

rows.Name: entity_types
Description: List of entity types that this mob can target when hurt by them

rows.Name: cooldown
rows.Description: The amount of time in seconds that the mob has to wait before selecting a target of the same type again

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: Conditions that make this entry in the list valid

rows.Name: max_dist
rows.Description: Maximum distance this mob can be away to be a valid choice

rows.Name: must_see
rows.Description: If true, the mob has to be visible to be a valid choice

rows.Name: must_see_forget_duration
rows.Description: Determines the amount of time in seconds that this mob will look for a target before forgetting about it and looking for a new one when the target isn't visible any more

rows.Name: reevaluate_description
rows.Description: If true, the mob will stop being targeted if it stops meeting any conditions.

rows.Name: sprint_speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Multiplier for the running speed. A value of 1.0 means the speed is unchanged

rows.Name: walk_speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Multiplier for the walking speed. A value of 1.0 means the speed is unchanged

rows.Name: hurt_owner
rows.Description: If true, the mob will hurt its owner and other mobs with the same owner as itself

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.inspect_bookshelf
content: Allows the mob to inspect bookshelves.

rows.Name: goal_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks within the mob considers it has reached the goal. This is the "wiggle room" to stop the AI from bouncing back and forth trying to reach a specific spot

rows.Name: search_count
rows.Description: The number of blocks each tick that the mob will check within its search range and height for a valid block to move to. A value of 0 will have the mob check every block within range in one tick

rows.Name: search_height
rows.Description: The height that the mob will search for bookshelves

rows.Name: search_range
rows.Description: Distance in blocks the mob will look for books to inspect

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.investigate_suspicious_location (See JSON Schema since 1.21.130)
content: Allows this entity to move towards a "suspicious" position based on data gathered in minecraft:suspect_tracking

rows.Name: goal_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks within the entity considers it has reached it's target position.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.jump_around_target
content: Allows an entity to jump around a target.

rows.Name: check_collision
rows.Description: Enables collision checks when calculating the jump. Setting check_collision to true may affect performance and should be used with care.

rows.Name: entity_bounding_box_scale
rows.Description: Scaling temporarily applied to the entity's AABB bounds when jumping. A smaller bounding box reduces the risk of collisions during the jump. When check_collision is true it also increases the chance of being able to jump when close to obstacles.

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: Conditions that need to be met for the behavior to start.

rows.Name: jump_angles
rows.Description: The jump angles in float degrees that are allowed when performing the jump. The order in which the angles are chosen is randomized.

rows.Name: jump_cooldown_duration
rows.Description: The time in seconds to spend in cooldown before this goal can be used again.

rows.Name: jump_cooldown_when_hurt_duration
rows.Description: The time in seconds to spend in cooldown after being hurt before this goal can be used again.

rows.Name: landing_distance_from_target
rows.Description: The range deciding how close to and how far away from the target the landing position can be when jumping.

rows.Name: landing_position_spread_degrees
rows.Description: This angle (in degrees) is used for controlling the spread when picking a landing position behind the target. A zero spread angle means the landing position will be straight behind the target with no variance. A 90 degree spread angle means the landing position can be up to 45 degrees to the left and to the right of the position straight behind the target's view direction.

rows.Name: last_hurt_duration
rows.Description: If the entity was hurt within these last seconds, the jump_cooldown_when_hurt_duration will be used instead of jump_cooldown_duration.

rows.Name: line_of_sight_obstruction_height_ignore
rows.Description: If the entity's line of sight towards its target is obstructed by an obstacle with a height below this number, the obstacle will be ignored, and the goal will try to find a valid landing position.

rows.Name: max_jump_velocity
rows.Description: Maximum velocity a jump can be performed at.

rows.Name: prepare_jump_duration
rows.Description: The time in seconds to spend preparing for the jump.

rows.Name: required_vertical_space
rows.Description: The number of blocks above the entity's head that has to be air for this goal to be usable.

rows.Name: snap_to_surface_block_range
rows.Description: The number of blocks above and below from the jump target position that will be checked to find a surface to land on.

rows.Name: valid_distance_to_target
rows.Description: Target needs to be within this range for the jump to happen.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.jump_to_block
content: Allows an entity to jump to another random block.

rows.Name: cooldown_range
rows.Description: Minimum and maximum cooldown time-range (positive, in seconds) between each attempted jump.

rows.Name: forbidden_blocks
rows.Description: Blocks that the mob can't jump to.

rows.Name: max_velocity
rows.Description: The maximum velocity with which the mob can jump.

rows.Name: minimum_distance
rows.Description: The minimum distance (in blocks) from the mob to a block, in order to consider jumping to it.

rows.Name: minimum_path_length
rows.Description: The minimum length (in blocks) of the mobs path to a block, in order to consider jumping to it.

rows.Name: preferred_blocks
rows.Description: Blocks that the mob prefers jumping to.

rows.Name: preferred_blocks_chance
rows.Description: Chance (between 0.0 and 1.0) that the mob will jump to a preferred block, if in range. Only matters if preferred blocks are defined.

rows.Name: scale_factor
rows.Description: The scalefactor of the bounding box of the mob while it is jumping.

rows.Name: search_height
rows.Description: The height (in blocks, in range [2, 15]) of the search box, centered around the mob.

rows.Name: search_width
rows.Description: The width (in blocks, in range [2, 15]) of the search box, centered around the mob.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.knockback_roar
content: Allows the mob to perform a damaging knockback that affects all nearby entities.

rows.Name: attack_time
rows.Description: The delay after which the knockback occurs (in seconds).

rows.Name: cooldown_time
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) the mob has to wait before using the goal again.

rows.Name: damage_filters
rows.Description: The list of conditions another entity must meet to be a valid target to apply damage to.

rows.Name: duration
rows.Description: The max duration of the roar (in seconds).

rows.Name: knockback_damage
rows.Description: The damage dealt by the knockback roar.

rows.Name: knockback_filters
rows.Description: The list of conditions another entity must meet to be a valid target to apply knockback to.

rows.Name: knockback_height_cap
rows.Description: The maximum height for vertical knockback.

rows.Name: knockback_horizontal_strength
rows.Description: The strength of the horizontal knockback.

rows.Name: knockback_range
rows.Description: The radius (in blocks) of the knockback effect.

rows.Name: knockback_vertical_strength
rows.Description: The strength of the vertical knockback.

rows.Name: on_roar_end
rows.Description: Event that is triggered when the roar ends.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.lay_down
content: Allows mobs to lay down at times

rows.Name: interval
rows.Description: A random value to determine at what intervals something can occur. This has a 1/interval chance to choose this goal

rows.Name: random_stop_interval
rows.Description: a random value in which the goal can use to pull out of the behavior. This is a 1/interval chance to play the sound

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.lay_egg
content: Allows the mob to lay an egg block on certain types of blocks if the mob is pregnant.

rows.Name: allow_laying_from_below
rows.Description: Allows the mob to lay its eggs from below the target if it can't get there. This is useful if the target block is water with air above, since mobs may not be able to get to the air block above water.

rows.Name: egg_type
rows.Description: Block type for the egg to lay. If this is a turtle egg, the number of eggs in the block is randomly set.

rows.Name: goal_radius
rows.Description: Distance in blocks within the mob considers it has reached the goal. This is the "wiggle room" to stop the AI from bouncing back and forth trying to reach a specific spot

rows.Name: lay_egg_sound
rows.Description: Name of the sound event played when laying the egg. Defaults to lay_egg, which is used for Turtles.

rows.Name: lay_seconds
rows.Description: Duration of the laying egg process in seconds.

rows.Name: on_lay
rows.Description: Event to run when this mob lays the egg.

rows.Name: search_height
rows.Description: Height in blocks the mob will look for a target block to move towards

rows.Name: search_range
rows.Description: The distance in blocks it will look for a target block to move towards

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

rows.Name: target_blocks
rows.Description: Blocks that the mob can lay its eggs on top of.

rows.Name: target_materials_above_block
rows.Description: Types of materials that can exist above the target block. Valid types are Air, Water, and Lava.

rows.Name: use_default_animation
rows.Description: Specifies if the default lay-egg animation should be played when the egg is placed or not.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.leap_at_target
content: Allows monsters to jump at and attack their target. Can only be used by hostile mobs.

rows.Name: must_be_on_ground
rows.Description: If true, the mob will only jump at its target if its on the ground. Setting it to false will allow it to jump even if its already in the air

rows.Name: set_persistent
rows.Description: Allows the actor to be set to persist upon targeting a player

rows.Name: yd
rows.Description: The height in blocks the mob jumps when leaping at its target

rows.Name: look_distance

rows.Name: probability

rows.Name: attack_once
rows.Description: Allows the entity to use this attack behavior, only once EVER.

rows.Name: attack_types
rows.Description: Defines the entity types this entity will attack.

rows.Name: can_spread_on_fire
rows.Description: If the entity is on fire, this allows the entity's target to catch on fire after being hit.

rows.Name: cooldown_time
rows.Description: Cooldown time (in seconds) between attacks.

rows.Name: inner_boundary_time_increase
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) to add to attack path recalculation when the target is beyond the "path_inner_boundary".

rows.Name: max_path_time
rows.Description: Maximum base time (in seconds) to recalculate new attack path to target (before increases applied).

rows.Name: melee_fov
rows.Description: Field of view (in degrees) when using the sensing component to detect an attack target.

rows.Name: min_path_time
rows.Description: Minimum base time (in seconds) to recalculate new attack path to target (before increases applied).

rows.Name: on_attack
rows.Description: Defines the event to trigger when this entity successfully attacks.

rows.Name: on_kill
rows.Description: Defines the event to trigger when this entity kills the target.

rows.Name: outer_boundary_time_increase
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) to add to attack path recalculation when the target is beyond the "path_outer_boundary".

rows.Name: path_fail_time_increase
rows.Description: Time (in seconds) to add to attack path recalculation when this entity cannot move along the current path.

rows.Name: path_inner_boundary
rows.Description: Distance at which to increase attack path recalculation by "inner_boundary_tick_increase".

rows.Name: path_outer_boundary
rows.Description: Distance at which to increase attack path recalculation by "outer_boundary_tick_increase".

rows.Name: random_stop_interval
rows.Description: This entity will have a 1 in N chance to stop it's current attack, where N = "random_stop_interval".

rows.Name: reach_multiplier
rows.Description: Used with the base size of the entity to determine minimum target-distance before trying to deal attack damage.

rows.Name: require_complete_path
rows.Description: Toggles (on/off) the need to have a full path from the entity to the target when using this melee attack behavior.

rows.Name: speed_multiplier
rows.Description: This multiplier modifies the attacking entity's speed when moving toward the target.

rows.Name: track_target
rows.Description: Allows the entity to track the attack target, even if the entity has no sensing.

rows.Name: x_max_rotation
rows.Description: Maximum rotation (in degrees), on the X-axis, this entity can rotate while trying to look at the target.

rows.Name: y_max_head_rotation
rows.Description: Maximum rotation (in degrees), on the Y-axis, this entity can rotate its head while trying to look at the target.

sections.name: minecraft:behavior.move_around_target
content: Allows an entity to move around a target. If the entity is too close (i.e. closer than destination range min and height difference limit) it will try to move away from its target. If the entity is too far away from its target it will try to move closer to a random position within the destination range. A randomized amount of those positions will be behind the target, and the spread can be tweaked with 'destination_pos_spread_degrees'.

rows.Name: destination_pos_spread_degrees
rows.Description: This angle (in degrees) is used for controlling the spread when picking a destination position behind the target. A zero spread angle means the destination position will be straight behind the target with no variance. A 90 degree spread angle means the destination position can be up to 45 degrees to the left and to the right of the position straight behind the target's view direction..

rows.Name: destination_position_range
rows.Description: The range of distances from the target entity within which the goal should look for a position to move the owner entity to.

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: Conditions that need to be met for the behavior to start.

rows.Name: height_difference_limit
rows.Description: Distance in height (in blocks) between the owner entity and the target has to be less than this value when owner checks if it is too close and should move away from the target. This value needs to be bigger than zero for the move away logic to trigger.

rows.Name: horizontal_search_distance
rows.Description: Horizontal search distance (in blocks) when searching for a position to move away from target.

rows.Name: movement_speed
rows.Description: The speed with which the entity should move to its target position.

rows.Name: vertical_search_distance
rows.Description: Vertical search distance (in blocks) when searching for a position to move away from target.
