rows.Description: Event to call when the entity is done peeking.

rows.Name: on_open
rows.Description: Event to call when the entity starts peeking.

rows.Name: on_target_open
rows.Description: Event to call when the entity's target entity starts peeking.

sections.name: minecraft:persistent
content: Defines whether an entity should be persistent in the game world.

sections.name: minecraft:physics
content: Defines physics properties of an actor, including if it is affected by gravity or if it collides with objects.

rows.Name: has_collision
rows.Description: Whether or not the object collides with things.

rows.Name: has_gravity
rows.Description: Whether or not the entity is affected by gravity.

rows.Name: push_towards_closest_space
rows.Description: Whether or not the entity should be pushed towards the nearest open area when stuck inside a block.

sections.name: minecraft:preferred_path
content: Specifies costing information for mobs that prefer to walk on preferred paths.

rows.Name: default_block_cost
rows.Description: Cost for non-preferred blocks

rows.Name: jump_cost
rows.Description: Added cost for jumping up a node

rows.Name: max_fall_blocks
rows.Description: Distance mob can fall without taking damage

rows.Name: preferred_path_blocks
rows.Description: A list of blocks with their associated cost

sections.name: minecraft:projectile
content: Allows the entity to be a thrown entity.

rows.Name: angle_offset
rows.Description: Determines the angle at which the projectile is thrown

rows.Name: catch_fire
rows.Description: If true, the entity hit will be set on fire

rows.Name: crit_particle_on_hurt
rows.Description: If true, the projectile will produce additional particles when a critical hit happens

rows.Name: destroy_on_hurt
rows.Description: If true, this entity will be destroyed when hit

rows.Name: filter
rows.Description: Entity Definitions defined here can't be hurt by the projectile

rows.Name: fire_affected_by_griefing
rows.Description: If true, whether the projectile causes fire is affected by the mob griefing game rule

rows.Name: gravity
rows.Description: The gravity applied to this entity when thrown. The higher the value, the faster the entity falls

rows.Name: hit_nearest_passenger
rows.Description: If true, when hitting a vehicle, and there's at least one passenger in the vehicle, the damage will be dealt to the passenger closest to the projectile impact point. If there are no passengers, this setting does nothing.

rows.Name: hit_sound
rows.Description: The sound that plays when the projectile hits something

rows.Name: homing
rows.Description: If true, the projectile homes in to the nearest entity

rows.Name: ignored_entities
rows.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] An array of strings defining the types of entities that this entity does not collide with.

rows.Name: inertia
rows.Description: The fraction of the projectile's speed maintained every frame while traveling in air

rows.Name: is_dangerous
rows.Description: If true, the projectile will be treated as dangerous to the players

rows.Name: knockback
rows.Description: If true, the projectile will knock back the entity it hits

rows.Name: lightning
rows.Description: If true, the entity hit will be struck by lightning

rows.Name: liquid_inertia
rows.Description: The fraction of the projectile's speed maintained every frame while traveling in water

rows.Name: multiple_targets
rows.Description: If true, the projectile can hit multiple entities per flight

rows.Name: offset
rows.Description: The offset from the entity's anchor where the projectile will spawn

rows.Name: on_fire_time
rows.Description: Time in seconds that the entity hit will be on fire for

rows.Name: particle
rows.Description: Particle to use upon collision

rows.Name: potion_effect
rows.Description: Defines the effect the arrow will apply to the entity it hits

rows.Name: power
rows.Description: Determines the velocity of the projectile

rows.Name: reflect_immunity
rows.Description: During the specified time, in seconds, the projectile cannot be reflected by hitting it

rows.Name: reflect_on_hurt
rows.Description: If true, this entity will be reflected back when hit

rows.Name: semi_random_diff_damage
rows.Description: If true, damage will be randomized based on damage and speed

rows.Name: shoot_sound
rows.Description: The sound that plays when the projectile is shot

rows.Name: shoot_target
rows.Description: If true, the projectile will be shot towards the target of the entity firing it

rows.Name: should_bounce
rows.Description: If true, the projectile will bounce upon hit

rows.Name: splash_potion
rows.Description: If true, the projectile will be treated like a splash potion

rows.Name: splash_range
rows.Description: Radius in blocks of the 'splash' effect

rows.Name: uncertainty_base
rows.Description: The base accuracy. Accuracy is determined by the formula uncertaintyBase - difficultyLevel * uncertaintyMultiplier

rows.Name: uncertainty_multiplier
rows.Description: Determines how much difficulty affects accuracy. Accuracy is determined by the formula uncertaintyBase - difficultyLevel * uncertaintyMultiplier

sections.name: minecraft:pushable
content: Defines what can push an entity between other entities and pistons.

rows.Name: is_pushable
rows.Description: Whether the entity can be pushed by other entities.

rows.Name: is_pushable_by_piston
rows.Description: Whether the entity can be pushed by pistons safely.

sections.name: minecraft:raid_trigger
content: Attempts to trigger a raid at the entity's location.

rows.Name: triggered_event
rows.Description: Event to run when a raid is triggered on the village.

sections.name: minecraft:rail_movement
content: Defines the entity's movement on the rails. An entity with this component is only allowed to move on the rail.

rows.Name: max_speed
rows.Description: Maximum speed that this entity will move at when on the rail.

rows.Name: check_block_types
rows.Description: If true, on tick this entity will trigger its on_deactivate behavior

rows.Name: eject_on_activate
rows.Description: If true, this entity will eject all of its riders when it passes over an activated rail

rows.Name: eject_on_deactivate
rows.Description: If true, this entity will eject all of its riders when it passes over a deactivated rail

rows.Name: on_activate
rows.Description: Event to call when the rail is activated

rows.Name: on_deactivate
rows.Description: Event to call when the rail is deactivated

rows.Name: tick_command_block_on_activate
rows.Description: If true, command blocks will start ticking when passing over an activated rail

rows.Name: tick_command_block_on_deactivate
rows.Description: If false, command blocks will stop ticking when passing over a deactivated rail

sections.name: minecraft:ravager_blocked
content: Defines the ravager's response to their melee attack being blocked.

rows.Name: knockback_strength
rows.Description: The strength with which blocking entities should be knocked back

rows.Name: reaction_choices
rows.Description: A list of weighted responses to the melee attack being blocked

sections.name: minecraft:reflect_projectiles
content: [EXPERIMENTAL] Allows an entity to reflect projectiles.

rows.Name: azimuth_angle
rows.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] A Molang expression defining the angle in degrees to add to the projectile's y axis rotation.

rows.Name: elevation_angle
rows.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] A Molang expression defining the angle in degrees to add to the projectile's x axis rotation.

rows.Name: reflected_projectiles
rows.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] An array of strings defining the types of projectiles that are reflected when they hit the entity.

rows.Name: reflection_scale
rows.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] A Molang expression defining the velocity scaling of the reflected projectile. Values below 1 decrease the projectile's velocity, and values above 1 increase it.

rows.Name: reflection_sound
rows.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] A string defining the name of the sound event to be played when a projectile is reflected. "reflect" unless specified.

sections.name: minecraft:rideable
content: Determines whether this entity can be ridden. Allows specifying the different seat positions and amount.

rows.Name: controlling_seat
rows.Description: The seat that designates the driver of the entity. Entities with the "minecraft:behavior.controlled_by_player" goal ignore this field and give control to any player in any seat.

rows.Name: crouching_skip_interact
rows.Description: If true, this entity can't be interacted with if the entity interacting with it is crouching.

rows.Name: dismount_mode
rows.Description: Defines where riders are placed when dismounting this entity:- "default", riders are placed on a valid ground position around the entity, or at the center of the entity's collision box if none is found.- "on_top_center", riders are placed at the center of the top of the entity's collision box.

rows.Name: family_types
rows.Description: List of entities that can ride this entity.

rows.Name: interact_text
rows.Description: The text to display when the player can interact with the entity when playing with touch-screen controls.

rows.Name: on_rider_enter_event
rows.Description: Event to execute on the owner entity when an entity starts riding it.

rows.Name: on_rider_exit_event
rows.Description: Event to execute on the owner entity when an entity stops riding it.

rows.Name: passenger_max_width
rows.Description: The max width a mob can have to be a rider. A value of 0 ignores this parameter.

rows.Name: priority
rows.Description: This field may exist in old data but isn't used by "minecraft:rideable".

rows.Name: pull_in_entities
rows.Description: If true, this entity will pull entities matching the specified "family_types" into any available seats. Entities that are leashed will only be pulled in if their distance to their leash holder is less than the "hard_distance" defined in their own "minecraft:leashable" component.

rows.Name: rider_can_interact
rows.Description: If true, this entity will be picked when looked at by the rider.

rows.Name: seat_count
rows.Description: The number of entities that can ride this entity at the same time.

rows.Name: seats
Description: The list of positions and number of riders for each position for entities riding this entity.

rows.Name: lock_rider_rotation
rows.Description: Angle in degrees that a rider is allowed to rotate while riding this entity. Omit this property for no limit.

rows.Name: max_rider_count
rows.Description: Defines the maximum number of riders that can be riding this entity for this seat to be valid.

rows.Name: min_rider_count
rows.Description: Defines the minimum number of riders that need to be riding this entity before this seat can be used.

rows.Name: position
rows.Description: Position of this seat relative to this entity's position.

rows.Name: rotate_rider_by
rows.Description: Offset to rotate riders by.

sections.name: minecraft:scale_by_age
content: Defines the entity's size interpolation based on the entity's age.

rows.Name: end_scale
rows.Description: Ending scale of the entity when it's fully grown.

rows.Name: start_scale
rows.Description: Initial scale of the newborn entity.

sections.name: minecraft:scheduler
content: Fires off scheduled mob events at time of day events.

rows.Name: scheduled_events
rows.Description: The list of triggers that fire when the conditions match the given filter criteria. If any filter criteria overlap the first defined event will be picked.

sections.name: minecraft:shareables
content: Defines a list of items the mob wants to share. Each item must have the following parameters:

rows.Name: all_items
rows.Description: A bucket for all other items in the game. Note this category is always least priority items.

rows.Name: all_items_max_amount
rows.Description: Maximum number of this item the mob will hold.

rows.Name: all_items_surplus_amount
rows.Description: Number of this item considered extra that the entity wants to share.

rows.Name: all_items_want_amount
rows.Description: Number of this item this entity wants to share.

rows.Name: items
Description: List of items or item tags that the entity wants to share. Items in-game will match to this list from top to bottom, meaning that the first occurance of a match, be it name or tag, will shadow those coming after.

content: Mob will admire the item after picking up by looking at it. For this to happen the mob needs to have an Admire component and an Admire goal.
Mob will barter for the item after picking it up. For this to work the mob needs to have a Barter component and a Barter goal.
Determines whether the mob will consume the item or not.
Defines the item this entity wants to craft with the item defined by "item". Should be an item name.
The name of the item. Aux value can be specified, for instance 'minecraft:skull:1'. Alternatively, a tag can be specified to match all items with that tag.
Maximum number of this item the mob will hold.
Maximum number items the mob will pick up during a single goal tick.
Determines whether the mob can only pickup the item and not drop it.
Prioritizes which items the entity prefers. 0 is the highest priority.
Determines whether the mob will try to put the item in its inventory if it has the inventory component and if it can't be equipped.
Number of this item considered extra that the entity wants to share.
Number of this item this entity wants to share.

rows.Name: singular_pickup
rows.Description: Boolean value that controls if the mob is able to pick up more of the same item if it is already holding that item

sections.name: minecraft:shooter
content: Defines the entity's ranged attack behavior. The "minecraft:behavior.ranged_attack" goal uses this component to determine which projectiles to shoot.

rows.Name: aux_val
rows.Description: ID of the Potion effect for the default projectile to be applied on hit.

rows.Name: def
rows.Description: Actor definition to use as the default projectile for the ranged attack. The actor definition must have the projectile component to be able to be shot as a projectile.

rows.Name: magic
rows.Description: Sets whether the projectiles being used are flagged as magic. If set, the ranged attack goal will not be used at the same time as other magic goals, such as minecraft:behavior.drink_potion

rows.Name: power
rows.Description: Velocity in which the projectiles will be shot at. A power of 0 will be overwritten by the default projectile throw power.

rows.Name: projectiles
rows.Description: List of projectiles that can be used by the shooter. Projectiles are evaluated in the order of the list; After a projectile is chosen, the rest of the list is ignored.

rows.Name: sound
rows.Description: Sound that is played when the shooter shoots a projectile.

sections.name: minecraft:sittable
content: Defines the entity's 'sit' state.

rows.Name: sit_event
rows.Description: Event to run when the entity enters the 'sit' state

rows.Name: stand_event
rows.Description: Event to run when the entity exits the 'sit' state

sections.name: minecraft:spawn_entity
content: Adds a timer after which this entity will spawn another entity or item (similar to vanilla's chicken's egg-laying behavior).

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: If present, the specified entity will only spawn if the filter evaluates to true.

rows.Name: max_wait_time
rows.Description: Maximum amount of time to randomly wait in seconds before another entity is spawned.

rows.Name: min_wait_time
rows.Description: Minimum amount of time to randomly wait in seconds before another entity is spawned.

rows.Name: num_to_spawn
rows.Description: The number of entities of this type to spawn each time that this triggers.

rows.Name: should_leash
rows.Description: If true, this the spawned entity will be leashed to the parent.

rows.Name: single_use
rows.Description: If true, this component will only ever spawn the specified entity once.

rows.Name: spawn_entity
rows.Description: Identifier of the entity to spawn, leave empty to spawn the item defined by "spawn_item" instead.

rows.Name: spawn_event
rows.Description: Event to call on the spawned entity when it spawns.

rows.Name: spawn_item
rows.Description: Item identifier of the item to spawn.

rows.Name: spawn_item_event
rows.Description: Event to call on this entity when the item is spawned.

rows.Name: spawn_method
rows.Description: Method to use to spawn the entity.

rows.Name: spawn_sound
rows.Description: Identifier of the sound effect to play when the entity is spawned.

sections.name: minecraft:suspect_tracking
content: Allows this entity to remember suspicious locations

sections.name: minecraft:tameable
content: Defines the rules for a mob to be tamed by the player.

rows.Name: probability
rows.Description: The chance of taming the entity with each item use between 0.0 and 1.0, where 1.0 is 100%

rows.Name: tame_event
rows.Description: Event to run when this entity becomes tamed

rows.Name: tame_items
rows.Description: The list of items that can be used to tame this entity

sections.name: minecraft:tamemount
content: Allows the Entity to be tamed by mounting it.

rows.Name: attempt_temper_mod
rows.Description: The amount the entity's temper will increase when mounted.

rows.Name: autoRejectItems
Description: The list of items that, if carried while interacting with the entity, will anger it.

rows.Name: item
rows.Description: Name of the item this entity dislikes and will cause it to get angry if used while untamed.

rows.Name: feed_items
Description: The list of items that can be used to increase the entity's temper and speed up the taming process.

rows.Name: item
rows.Description: Name of the item this entity likes and can be used to increase this entity's temper.

rows.Name: temper_mod
rows.Description: The amount of temper this entity gains when fed this item.

rows.Name: feed_text
rows.Description: The text that shows in the feeding interact button.

rows.Name: max_temper
rows.Description: The maximum value for the entity's random starting temper.

rows.Name: min_temper
rows.Description: The minimum value for the entity's random starting temper.

rows.Name: ride_text
rows.Description: The text that shows in the riding interact button.

rows.Name: tame_event
rows.Description: Event that triggers when the entity becomes tamed.

sections.name: minecraft:target_nearby_sensor
content: Defines the entity's range within which it can see or sense other entities to target them.

rows.Name: inside_range
rows.Description: Maximum distance in blocks that another entity will be considered in the 'inside' range

rows.Name: must_see
rows.Description: Whether the other entity needs to be visible to trigger 'inside' events

rows.Name: on_inside_range
rows.Description: Event to call when an entity gets in the inside range. Can specify 'event' for the name of the event and 'target' for the target of the event

rows.Name: on_outside_range
rows.Description: Event to call when an entity gets in the outside range. Can specify 'event' for the name of the event and 'target' for the target of the event

rows.Name: on_vision_lost_inside_range
rows.Description: Event to call when an entity exits visual range. Can specify 'event' for the name of the event and 'target' for the target of the event

rows.Name: outside_range
rows.Description: Maximum distance in blocks that another entity will be considered in the 'outside' range

sections.name: minecraft:teleport
content: Defines an entity's teleporting behavior.

rows.Name: dark_teleport_chance
rows.Description: Modifies the chance that the entity will teleport if the entity is in darkness

rows.Name: light_teleport_chance
rows.Description: Modifies the chance that the entity will teleport if the entity is in daylight

rows.Name: max_random_teleport_time
rows.Description: Maximum amount of time in seconds between random teleports

rows.Name: min_random_teleport_time
rows.Description: Minimum amount of time in seconds between random teleports

rows.Name: random_teleport_cube
rows.Description: Entity will teleport to a random position within the area defined by this cube

rows.Name: random_teleports
rows.Description: If true, the entity will teleport randomly

rows.Name: target_distance
rows.Description: Maximum distance the entity will teleport when chasing a target

rows.Name: target_teleport_chance
rows.Description: The chance that the entity will teleport between 0.0 and 1.0. 1.0 means 100%

sections.name: minecraft:timer
content: Adds a timer after which an event will fire.

rows.Name: looping
rows.Description: If true, the timer will restart every time after it fires.

rows.Name: randomInterval
rows.Description: If true, the amount of time on the timer will be random between the min and max values specified in time.

rows.Name: random_time_choices
rows.Description: This is a list of objects, representing one value in seconds that can be picked before firing the event and an optional weight. Incompatible with time.

rows.Name: time
rows.Description: Amount of time in seconds for the timer. Can be specified as a number or a pair of numbers (min and max). Incompatible with random_time_choices.

rows.Name: time_down_event
rows.Description: Event to fire when the time on the timer runs out.

sections.name: minecraft:trade_table
content: Defines this entity's ability to trade with players.

rows.Name: convert_trades_economy
rows.Description: Determines when the mob transforms, if the trades should be converted when the new mob has a economy_trade_table. When the trades are converted, the mob will generate a new trade list with their new trade table, but then it will try to convert any of the same trades over to have the same enchantments and user data. For example, if the original has a Emerald to Enchanted Iron Sword (Sharpness 1), and the new trade also has an Emerald for Enchanted Iron Sword, then the enchantment will be Sharpness 1.

rows.Name: display_name
rows.Description: Name to be displayed while trading with this entity.

rows.Name: new_screen
rows.Description: Used to determine if trading with entity opens the new trade screen.

rows.Name: persist_trades
rows.Description: Determines if the trades should persist when the mob transforms. This makes it so that the next time the mob is transformed to something with a trade_table or economy_trade_table, then it keeps their trades.

rows.Name: table
rows.Description: File path relative to the behavior pack root for this entity's trades.

sections.name: minecraft:trail
content: Causes an entity to leave a trail of blocks as it moves about the world.

rows.Name: block_type
rows.Description: The type of block you wish to be spawned by the entity as it move about the world. Solid blocks may not be spawned at an offset of (0,0,0).

rows.Name: spawn_filter
rows.Description: One or more conditions that must be met in order to cause the chosen block type to spawn.

rows.Name: spawn_offset
rows.Description: The distance from the entities current position to spawn the block. Capped at up to 16 blocks away. The X value is left/right(-/+), the Z value is backward/forward(-/+), the Y value is below/above(-/+).

sections.name: minecraft:transformation
content: Defines an entity's transformation from the current definition into another

rows.Name: add
Description: List of components to add to the entity after the transformation

rows.Name: component_groups
rows.Description: Names of component groups to add

rows.Name: begin_transform_sound
rows.Description: Sound to play when the transformation starts

rows.Name: delay
Description: Defines the properties of the delay for the transformation

rows.Name: block_assist_chance
rows.Description: Chance that the entity will look for nearby blocks that can speed up the transformation. Value must be between 0.0 and 1.0

rows.Name: block_chance
rows.Description: Chance that, once a block is found, will help speed up the transformation

rows.Name: block_max
rows.Description: Maximum number of blocks the entity will look for to aid in the transformation. If not defined or set to 0, it will be set to the block radius

rows.Name: block_radius
rows.Description: Distance in Blocks that the entity will search for blocks that can help the transformation

rows.Name: block_types
rows.Description: List of blocks that can help the transformation of this entity

rows.Name: range_max
rows.Description: Time in seconds to be added to value to have the maximum random time range value until the entity transforms (if non-zero then the time in seconds before the entity transforms will be random between value+range_min and value+range_max)

rows.Name: range_min
rows.Description: Time in seconds to be added to value to have the minimum random time range value until the entity transforms (if non-zero then the time in seconds before the entity transforms will be random between value+range_min and value+range_max)

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: Time in seconds before the entity transforms

rows.Name: drop_equipment
rows.Description: Cause the entity to drop all equipment upon transformation

rows.Name: drop_inventory
rows.Description: Cause the entity to drop all items in inventory upon transformation

rows.Name: into
rows.Description: Entity Definition that this entity will transform into

rows.Name: keep_level
rows.Description: If this entity has trades and has leveled up, it should maintain that level after transformation.

rows.Name: keep_owner
rows.Description: If this entity is owned by another entity, it should remain owned after transformation.

rows.Name: preserve_equipment
rows.Description: Cause the entity to keep equipment after going through transformation

rows.Name: transformation_sound
rows.Description: Sound to play when the entity is done transforming

sections.name: minecraft:transient
content: An entity with this component will NEVER persist, and forever disappear when unloaded.

sections.name: minecraft:trusting
content: Defines the rules for a mob to trust players.

rows.Name: probability
rows.Description: The chance of the entity trusting with each item use between 0.0 and 1.0, where 1.0 is 100%.

rows.Name: trust_event
rows.Description: Event to run when this entity becomes trusting.

rows.Name: trust_items
rows.Description: The list of items that can be used to get the entity to trust players.

sections.name: minecraft:underwater_mount_breathing
content: Pauses this entity's breathing under water.

sections.name: minecraft:variable_max_auto_step
content: Entities with this component will have a maximum auto step height that is different depending on whether they are on a block that prevents jumping. Incompatible with "runtime_identifier": "minecraft:horse".

rows.Name: base_value
rows.Description: The maximum auto step height when on any other block.

rows.Name: controlled_value
rows.Description: The maximum auto step height when on any other block and controlled by the player.

rows.Name: jump_prevented_value
rows.Description: The maximum auto step height when on a block that prevents jumping.

sections.name: minecraft:vertical_movement_action
content: When configured as a rideable entity, the entity will move upwards or downwards when the player uses the jump action.

rows.Name: vertical_velocity
rows.Description: Vertical velocity to apply when jump action is issued.

sections.name: minecraft:vibration_damper
content: Vibrations emitted by this entity will be ignored.

rows.Name: drag_factor
rows.Description: Drag factor to determine movement speed when in water.

sections.name: Entity Definition Properties
content: These properties are part of the Entity Definition as a whole and go before the Component or Component Groups. Make sure to place them before any Components, Component Groups or Events sections or they will be ignored.

sections.name: format_version
content: Specifies the version of the game this entity was made in. If the version is lower than the current version, any changes made to the entity in the vanilla version will be applied to it.

sections.name: Code Example
content: Example
"format_version": "1.8.0",
"minecraft:entity": {
"component_groups": {

sections.name: Entity Description Properties
content: This section defines properties required to identify and construct the entity

sections.name: identifier
content: Sets the name for this entity's description.

rows.Description: The identifier for this entity

sections.name: is_spawnable
content: Sets whether or not this entity has a spawn egg in the creative ui.

rows.Description: Set to determine if this entity has a spawn egg.

sections.name: is_summonable
content: Sets whether or not we can summon this entity using commands such as /summon.

rows.Description: Flag to mark this entity as being summonable or not.

sections.name: runtime_identifier
content: Sets the name for the Vanilla Minecraft identifier this entity will use to build itself from.

rows.Description: The identifier for the class to construct this entity with

sections.name: spawn_category
content: Sets the Spawn Category type of this entity. This entity will spawn with the rest of this Spawn Category type.

rows.Description: The Spawn Category type of this entity, used to spawn the entity.

sections.name: animations
content: Sets the mapping of internal animation references to actual animations.  This is a JSON Object of name/animation pairs

rows.Name: animation
rows.Description: Actual animation to use

rows.Name: name
rows.Description: Internal (to the entity) name of this animation entry

sections.name: scripts
content: Sets the mapping of internal animation controller references to actual animation controller.  This is a JSON Array of name/animation-controller pairs

rows.Name: animation controller
rows.Description: Actual animation to use

rows.Name: name
rows.Description: Internal (to the entity) name of this animation entry

sections.name: minecraft:ambient_sound_interval
content: Sets the entity's delay between playing its ambient sound.

rows.Name: event_name
rows.Description: Level sound event to be played as the ambient sound.

rows.Name: event_names
Description: List of dynamic level sound events, with conditions for choosing between them. Evaluated in order, first one wins. If none evaluate to true, 'event_name' will take precedence.

content: The condition that must be satisfied to select the given ambient sound
Level sound event to be played as the ambient sound

rows.Name: range
rows.Description: Maximum time in seconds to randomly add to the ambient sound delay time.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: Minimum time in seconds before the entity plays its ambient sound again.

sections.name: minecraft:body_rotation_always_follows_head
content: Causes the entity's body rotation to match the one of their head.
Does not override the "minecraft:body_rotation_blocked" component.

sections.name: minecraft:body_rotation_blocked
content: When set, the entity will no longer visually rotate their body to match their facing direction.

sections.name: minecraft:body_rotation_locked_to_vehicle
content: Causes the entity's body rotation to match their vehicle's facing direction.

sections.name: minecraft:can_climb
content: Allows this entity to climb up ladders.

sections.name: minecraft:can_fly
content: Marks the entity as being able to fly, the pathfinder won't be restricted to paths where a solid block is required underneath it.

sections.name: minecraft:can_power_jump
content: Allows the entity to power jump like the Horse does in Vanilla.

sections.name: minecraft:cannot_be_attacked
content: When set, blocks entities from attacking the owner entity unless they have the "minecraft:ignore_cannot_be_attacked" component.

sections.name: minecraft:color
content: Defines the entity's color. Only works on vanilla entities that have predefined color values (sheep, llama, shulker).

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The Palette Color value of the entity.

sections.name: minecraft:color2
content: Defines the entity's second texture color. Only works on vanilla entities that have a second predefined color values (tropical fish).

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The second Palette Color value of the entity.

sections.name: minecraft:default_look_angle
content: Sets this entity's default head rotation angle.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: Angle in degrees.

sections.name: minecraft:equipment
content: Sets the Equipment table to use for this Entity.

rows.Name: slot_drop_chance
rows.Description: A list of slots with the chance to drop an equipped item from that slot.

rows.Name: table
rows.Description: The file path to the equipment table, relative to the behavior pack's root.

sections.name: minecraft:fire_immune
content: Sets that this entity doesn't take damage from fire.

sections.name: minecraft:floats_in_liquid
content: Sets that this entity can float in liquid blocks.

sections.name: minecraft:flying_speed
content: Speed in Blocks that this entity flies at.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: Flying speed in blocks per tick.

sections.name: minecraft:friction_modifier
content: Defines how much friction affects this entity.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The higher the number, the more the friction affects this entity. A value of 1.0 means regular friction, while 2.0 means twice as much.

sections.name: minecraft:ground_offset
content: Sets the offset from the ground that the entity is actually at.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The value of the entity's offset from the terrain, in blocks.

sections.name: minecraft:ignore_cannot_be_attacked
content: When set, blocks entities from attacking the owner entity unless they have the "minecraft:ignore_cannot_be_attacked" component.

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: Defines which entities are exceptions and are allowed to be attacked by the owner entity, potentially attacked entity is subject "other". If this is not specified then all attacks by the owner are allowed.

sections.name: minecraft:input_ground_controlled
content: When configured as a rideable entity, the entity will be controlled using WASD controls. Beginning with 1.19.50 the default auto step height for rideable entities is half a block. Consider adding the "minecraft:variable_max_auto_step" component to increase it.

sections.name: minecraft:is_baby
content: Sets that this entity is a baby.

sections.name: minecraft:is_charged
content: Sets that this entity is charged.

sections.name: minecraft:is_chested
content: Sets that this entity is currently carrying a chest.

sections.name: minecraft:is_collidable
content: Allows other mobs to have vertical and horizontal collisions with this mob. For a collision to occur, both mobs must have a "minecraft:collision_box" component. This component can only be used on mobs and enables collisions exclusively between mobs.
Please note that this type of collision is unreliable for moving collidable mobs. It is recommended to use this component only in scenarios where the collidable mob remains stationary.

Collidable behavior is closely related to stackable behavior. While the "minecraft:is_collidable" component governs how other mobs interact with the component's owner, the "minecraft:is_stackable" component describes how an entity interacts with others of its own kind.

sections.name: minecraft:is_dyeable
content: Allows dyes to be used on this entity to change its color.

rows.Name: interact_text
rows.Description: The text that will display when interacting with this entity with a dye when playing with Touch-screen controls.

sections.name: minecraft:is_hidden_when_invisible
content: Sets that this entity can hide from hostile mobs while invisible.

sections.name: minecraft:is_ignited
content: Sets that this entity is currently on fire.

sections.name: minecraft:is_illager_captain
content: Sets that this entity is an Illager Captain.

sections.name: minecraft:is_pregnant
content: Sets that this entity is currently pregnant.

sections.name: minecraft:is_saddled
content: Sets that this entity is currently saddled.

sections.name: minecraft:is_shaking
content: Sets that this entity is currently shaking.

sections.name: minecraft:is_sheared
content: Sets that this entity is currently sheared.

sections.name: minecraft:is_stackable
content: Allows instances of this entity to have vertical and horizontal collisions with each other. For a collision to occur, both instances must have a "minecraft:collision_box" component.

Stackable behavior is closely related to collidable behavior. While the "minecraft:is_stackable" component describes how an entity interacts with others of its own kind, the "minecraft:is_collidable" component governs how other mobs interact with the component's owner.

sections.name: minecraft:is_stunned
content: Sets that this entity is currently stunned.

sections.name: minecraft:is_tamed
content: Sets that this entity is currently tamed.

sections.name: minecraft:item_controllable
content: Defines what items can be used to control this entity while ridden.

rows.Name: control_items
rows.Description: List of items that can be used to control this entity.

sections.name: minecraft:loot
content: Sets the loot table for what items this entity drops upon death.

rows.Name: table
rows.Description: The path to the loot table, relative to the Behavior Pack's root.

sections.name: minecraft:mark_variant
content: Additional variant value. Can be used to further differentiate variants.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The ID of the variant. By convention, 0 is the ID of the base entity.

sections.name: minecraft:movement_sound_distance_offset
content: Sets the offset used to determine the next step distance for playing a movement sound.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The higher the number, the less often the movement sound will be played.

sections.name: minecraft:push_through
content: Sets the distance through which the entity can push through.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The value of the entity's push-through, in blocks.

sections.name: minecraft:renders_when_invisible
content: When set, the entity will render even when invisible. Appropriate rendering behavior can then be specified in the corresponding "minecraft:client_entity".

sections.name: minecraft:rotation_axis_aligned
content: Causes the entity to automatically rotate to align with the nearest cardinal direction based on its current facing direction.

Combining this with the "minecraft:body_rotation_blocked" component will cause the entity's body to align with the nearest cardinal direction and remain fixed in that orientation, regardless of changes in its facing direction.

sections.name: minecraft:scale
content: Sets the entity's visual size.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The value of the scale. 1.0 means the entity will appear at the scale they are defined in their model. Higher numbers make the entity bigger.

sections.name: minecraft:skin_id
content: Skin ID value. Can be used to differentiate skins, such as base skins for villagers.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The ID of the skin. By convention, 0 is the ID of the base skin.

sections.name: minecraft:sound_volume
content: Sets the entity's base volume for sound effects.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The value of the volume the entity uses for sound effects.

sections.name: minecraft:type_family
content: Defines the families this entity belongs to.

rows.Name: family
rows.Description: List of family names.

sections.name: minecraft:variant
content: Used to differentiate the component group of a variant of an entity from others. (e.g. ocelot, villager)

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The ID of the variant. By convention, 0 is the ID of the base entity.

sections.name: minecraft:walk_animation_speed
content: Sets the speed multiplier for this entity's walk animation speed.

rows.Name: value
rows.Description: The higher the number, the faster the animation for walking plays. A value of 1.0 means normal speed, while 2.0 means twice as fast.

sections.name: minecraft:wants_jockey
content: Sets that this entity wants to become a jockey.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event to run when the conditions for this trigger are met.

rows.Name: filters
rows.Description: The list of conditions for this trigger to execute.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of the event.
